intro: Weinmannia hieronymi, commonly known as the Hierarchy Weinmannia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes of South America. It belongs to the family Cunoniaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and compound leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
